page.title: 08Gothenburg City Wreck (con)
page.content: as we got onboard had to make tracks for the rigging while the rest fell back into the boats. Rats, I never sawso many in my life and never hope to again. Great, hungry, lanky, lean looking rats many of them with teir tails chewed off. Swarmed up from below in never ending thousands, squeaking and squirming one over another in a manner sickening to behold particulary to those of us up in the rigging. At last we cut off some loose ropes knotted them into convenient lengths and so we descended armed and attacked the rodents eventually succeeding into beating a passage to our boat." What happened to the rats is not recorded but the wreck was salvaged in parts by the Tyneside Shipping Company.
